page.title: 07MORRISTON ORPHEUS, SWANSEA
page.content: The Morriston Orpheus Choir was founded in 1935 by Ivor Sims. It has about 100 members, ranging up to 75 years of age. It is an all-male choir, except for the accompanist. The choir celebrated its 50th. anniversary this year by entering the Nancy Festival with other choirs from all over Europe. The celebration continues later in the year when they visit Germany. The choir has won competitions all over the world, including the Welsh National Eisteddfod, and has had the honour of appearing before royalty,- the Prince of Wales and Princess Diana. Tours have been made to America, Europe, and all over Britain. The choir has made records and television appearances and given many charity concerts. Their singing is perhaps the best in the world.
